___typeProperties.description: Data Lake Analytics U-SQL activity properties.

___script.description: The U-SQL script. This cannot be used at the same time as ScriptPath and ScriptLinkedService.

___degreeOfParallelism.description: The maximum number of nodes that will be used simultaneously to run the job.

___scriptPath.description: The path to the U-SQL script in the ScriptLinkedService. This needs to be used at the same time as ScriptLinkedService.

___runtimeVersion.description: Runtime version of U-SQL engine to use.

___parameters.description: Allows user to specify parameters for the U-SQL activity.

$eref.description: Compilation mode for a U-SQL activity.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.USqlCompilationMode

___compilationMode.description: Compilation mode of U-SQL. Must be one of the USqlCompilationMode

___scriptLinkedService.description: The linked service hosting the U-SQL script. This needs to be used at the same time as ScriptPath.

___priority.description: Determines which jobs out of all that are queued should be selected to run first. The lower the number, the higher the priority (minimum is 0).

___defines.description: Allows user to specify defines for the Pig job request.

$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.HDInsightActivityDebugInfoOption

___concurrency.description: The maximum number of concurrent activity executions.

___executionPriorityOrder.description: Execution priority order.  Choose from OldestFirst or NewestFirst.

___timeout.description: Specifies the timeout for the activity to run. If there is value specified, it takes the value of TimeSpan.FromMilliseconds(-1) which means indefinite timeout.

___delay.description: Delay activity execution so that upstream activities can have extra time to finish.

___retry.description: Total number of short retries for a failed activity.

___longRetry.description: Total number of long retries after failed short retries.

___defines.description: Allows user to specify defines for Hive job request.

$eref.description: All available options on how to get the YARN logs for HDInsight activities.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.HDInsightActivityDebugInfoOption

___rejectType.description: Indicates whether the RejectValue property is specified as a literal value or a percentage.

___useTypeDefault.description: Specifies how to handle missing values in delimited text files when PolyBase retrieves data from the text file.

___rejectValue.description: Specifies the value or the percentage of rows that can be rejected before the query fails.

___rejectSampleValue.description: Determines the number of rows to attempt to retrieve before the PolyBase recalculates the percentage of rejected rows.

___extendedProperties.description: User defined property bag. There is no restriction on the keys or values that can be used. The user specified .NET activity has the full responsibility to consume and interpret the content defined.

_88webSource.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.WebSource

_88sqlDWSink.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.SqlDWSink

$eref.description: PolyBase settings.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.PolyBaseSettings

___rejectType.description: Indicates whether the RejectValue property is specified as a literal value or a percentage.

___useTypeDefault.description: Specifies how to handle missing values in delimited text files when PolyBase retrieves data from the text file.

___rejectValue.description: Specifies the value or the percentage of rows that can be rejected before the query fails.

___rejectSampleValue.description: Determines the number of rows to attempt to retrieve before the PolyBase recalculates the percentage of rejected rows.

___polyBaseSettings.description: Specifies PolyBase-related settings when AllowPolyBase is true.

___allowPolyBase.description: Indicates to use PolyBase to copy data into SQL Data Warehouse when applicable.

___sliceIdentifierColumnName.description: Name of the SQL column which is used to save slice identifier information, to support idempotent copy.

___pipelineMode.description: The method of scheduling runs for the pipeline. 'Scheduled' indicates that the pipeline will run at a specified time interval according to its active period (start and end time). 'OneTime' indicates that the pipeline will run only once.

___start.description: The start time of the pipeline.

___isPaused.description: The status of the pipline. Pipeline is paused when boolean is set to true.

___activities.description: Activities that belong to the pipeline.

___expirationTime.description: Duration of time after creation for which the pipeline is valid and should remain provisioned. The pipeline will be deleted automatically once it reaches the expiration time if it does not have any active or pending runs.

___end.description: The end time of the pipeline.

___hubName.description: The name of the Hub that this pipeline belongs to.

___query.description: Database query. Should be a SQL-92 query expression or Cassandra Query Language (CQL) command.

___consistencyLevel.description: The consistency level specifies how many Cassandra servers must respond to a read request before returning data to the client application. Cassandra checks the specified number of Cassandra servers for data to satisfy the read request. Must be one of cassandraSourceReadConsistencyLevels. The default value is 'ONE'. It is case-insensitive.

$eref.description: A pipeline activity.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.BaseActivity

___linkedServiceName.description: LinkedService name where the Activity Runs.

___anchorDateTime.description: The date used as a reference point for calculating slice start and end dates.

___interval.description: The interval of running the scheduler.

___frequency.description: Frequency in terms of minute, hour, day, etc.

___offset.description: The offset relative to the anchor time.

$eref.description: Copy activity.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.CopyActivity

___executionLocation.description: The execution region of the Copy Activity. Should be one of the region supported by ADF Data Movement, e.g. "West US".

___stagingSettings.description: Specifies interim staging settings when EnableStaging is true.

___enableStaging.description: Specifies whether to copy data via an interim staging. Default value is false.

___parallelCopies.description: Maximum number of concurrent sessions opened on the source or sink to avoid overloading the data store.

___cloudDataMovementUnits.description: Maximum number of cloud data movement units that can be used to perform this data movement.

___translator.description: Copy activity translator. If not specificed, tabular translator is used.

$eref.description: SQL Stored Procedure activity.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.SqlServerStoredProcedureActivity

___storedProcedureParameters.description: User specified property bag used in Stored Procedure. There is no restriction on the keys or values that can be used. User needs to consume and interpret the content accordingly in their customized Stored Procedure.

$eref.description: Azure ML Web Service batch scoring activity.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.AzureMLBatchScoringActivity

___webServiceParameters.description: Key,Value pairs to be passed to the Azure ML Batch Execution Service Endpoint (these are also referred to as GlobalParameters). Keys must match the names of web service parameters defined in published the Azure ML web service. Values may include ADF macros to be resolved at each slice execution time.

$eref.description: Azure ML Batch Execution Service activity.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.AzureMLBatchExecutionActivity

___globalParameters.description: Key,Value pairs to be passed to the Azure ML Batch Execution Service Endpoint Keys must match the names of web service parameters defined in the published Azure ML web service. Values may include ADF functions to be resolved at each slice execution time (See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn835056.aspx). Values will be passed in the GlobalParameters property of the Azure ML batch execution request.

___webServiceOutputs.description: Key,Value pairs mapping the Azure ML endpoint's Web Service Output names to names of ADF Blob datasets where the batch execution output should be written. This information will be passed in the WebServiceOutputs property of the Azure ML batch execution request. Mapped Datasets must be included in the Activity's Outputs.

___webServiceInputs.description: Key,Value pairs mapping the Azure ML endpoint's Web Service Input names to names of ADF Blob datasets from where the batch execution input should be read. This information will be passed in the WebServiceInputs property of the Azure ML batch execution request. Mapped Datasets must be included in the Activity's Inputs.

___webServiceInput.description: Name of ADF Blob dataset giving the input to the batch execution. This information will be passed in the WebServiceInput property of the Azure ML batch execution request.

$eref.description: Azure ML Update Resource management activity.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.AzureMLUpdateResourceActivity

___trainedModelDatasetName.description: Name of ADF Blob Dataset representing the .ilearner file that will be uploaded by the update operation. The Dataset must be included in this Activity's pipeline Inputs.

___trainedModelName.description: Name of the Trained Model module in the Web Service experiment to be updated.
